com.example.federico.wearableui.model.gaze

Class Gaze

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.federico.wearableui.model.gaze.Gaze
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGaze

    public class Gaze
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGaze
    This class models the user's Gaze, by keeping track of its orientation. Such orientation is used to scroll the Viewport accordingly. This class is also a Singleton, since there only has to be one instance of it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calibrate(Quaternion calibration)
      Sets the Gaze calibration Quaternion.
      Quaternion getCurrentCalibration()
      This method returns the starting position of the Gaze, which is also the starting position of the device.
      float getGazePitch()
      Returns the pitch angle of the Gaze relative to the device coordinate system.
      float getGazeYaw()
      Returns the yaw angle of the Gaze relative to the device coordinate system.
      static IGaze getInstance()
      Returns the Singleton instance.
      Quaternion getOrientationRelativeToWCS()
      This method returns the orientation of the Gaze expressed according to the World Coordinate System.
      void updateGazeOrientation(Quaternion orientation)
      Updates the Gaze orientation.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static IGaze getInstance()
        Returns the Singleton instance.
        Returns:
        the Singleton instance.

      • updateGazeOrientation

        public void updateGazeOrientation(Quaternion orientation)
        Description copied from interface: IGaze
        Updates the Gaze orientation.
        Specified by:
        updateGazeOrientation in interface IGaze
        Parameters:
        orientation - a Quaternion that represents the new orientation of the Gaze expressed in the World Coordinate System. By calculating the difference between this orientation and the one that has been set as calibration, it is possible to obtain the Gaze orientation relative to the device coordinate system.

      • calibrate

        public void calibrate(Quaternion calibration)
        Description copied from interface: IGaze
        Sets the Gaze calibration Quaternion.
        Specified by:
        calibrate in interface IGaze
        Parameters:
        calibration - a Quaternion that represents the starting position of the Gaze, expressed in the World Coordinate System. By calculating the difference between the future orientations provided (expressed in the WCS) and this one, it is possible to obtain the Gaze orientation relative to the device coordinate system.

      • getOrientationRelativeToWCS

        public Quaternion getOrientationRelativeToWCS()
        Description copied from interface: IGaze
        This method returns the orientation of the Gaze expressed according to the World Coordinate System.
        Specified by:
        getOrientationRelativeToWCS in interface IGaze
        Returns:
        a Quaternion representing the orientation of the Gaze according to the World Coordinate System.

        public Quaternion getCurrentCalibration()

        Returns:
